comment._content: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Leo_Callahan Leo David Callahan (August 9, 1890 in Jamaica Plain, Massachusetts - May 2, 1982 in Erie, Pennsylvania), is a former professional baseball player who played outfield for the 1913 Brooklyn Dodgers and the 1919 Philadelphia Phillies. Here is image from same set: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4909926247]

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content: Callahan was aboard the Savannah Line ship, "City of Macon," en route with other players to the Dodgers' spring training camp in Georgia.
